verses.verse: For before these days There were no (Hag. 1:6, 9) wages for man nor any hire for beast; There was no peace from the enemy for whoever went out or came in; For I set all men, everyone, against his neighbor.
((Ps. 103:9); Is. 12:1; Hag. 2:15-19) But now I will not treat the remnant of this people as in the former days,’ says the LORD of hosts.

‘For (Joel 2:22) the seed shall be prosperous, The vine shall give its fruit, (Ps. 67:6) The ground shall give her increase, And (Hag. 1:10) the heavens shall give their dew— I will cause the remnant of this people To possess all these.

And it shall come to pass That just as you were (Jer. 42:18) a curse among the nations, O house of Judah and house of Israel, So I will save you, and (Gen. 12:2; Ruth 4:11, 12; Is. 19:24, 25; Ezek. 34:26; (Zeph. 3:20)) you shall be a blessing. Do not fear, Let your hands be strong.’
“For thus says the LORD of hosts: (Jer. 31:28) ‘Just as I determined to punish you When your fathers provoked Me to wrath,’ Says the LORD of hosts, ((2 Chr. 36:16)) ‘And I would not relent,
So again in these days I am determined to do good To Jerusalem and to the house of Judah. Do not fear.

These are the things you shall (Zech. 7:9, 10) do: (Ps. 15:2; (Prov. 12:17-19); Zech. 8:3; (Eph. 4:25)) Speak each man the truth to his neighbor; Give judgment in your gates for truth, justice, and peace;
(Prov. 3:29; Jer. 4:14; Zech. 7:10) Let none of you think evil in your heart against your neighbor; And do not love a false oath. For all these are things that I hate,’ Says the LORD.”
Then the word of the LORD of hosts came to me, saying,

“Thus says the LORD of hosts: (Jer. 52:6) ‘The fast of the fourth month, (Jer. 52:12) The fast of the fifth, (2 Kin. 25:25; Jer. 41:1, 2) The fast of the seventh, (Jer. 52:4) And the fast of the tenth, Shall be (Esth. 8:17) joy and gladness and cheerful feasts For the house of Judah. (Zech. 8:16; Luke 1:74, 75) Therefore love truth and peace.’
“Thus says the LORD of hosts: ‘Peoples shall yet come, Inhabitants of many cities;
The inhabitants of one city shall go to another, saying, ((Is. 2:2, 3; Mic. 4:1, 2)) “Let us continue to go and pray before the LORD, And seek the LORD of hosts. I myself will go also.”
Yes, (Is. 60:3; 66:23; (Zech. 14:16-21)) many peoples and strong nations Shall come to seek the LORD of hosts in Jerusalem, And to pray before the LORD.’

“Thus says the LORD of hosts: ‘In those days ten men (Is. 3:6) from every language of the nations shall ((Is. 45:14)) grasp the sleeve of a Jewish man, saying, “Let us go with you, for we have heard (1 Cor. 14:25) that God is with you.” ’ ”

(Israel Defended Against Enemies) The burden of the word of the LORD Against the land of Hadrach, And (Is. 17:1; Jer. 23:33) Damascus its resting place (For (Amos 1:3-5) the eyes of men And all the tribes of Israel Are on the LORD);
Also against (Jer. 49:23) Hamath, which borders on it, And against (Is. 23; Jer. 25:22; 47:4; Ezek. 26; Amos 1:9, 10) Tyre and (1 Kin. 17:9) Sidon, though they are very (Ezek. 28:3) wise.
For Tyre built herself a tower, Heaped up silver like the dust, And gold like the mire of the streets.
